conversation.message: Hello School_C Admissions Committee—I'm Student_D. School_C is my first-choice school because I’m especially interested in the environment and academic fit it offers. I would be excited to commit and contribute positively to the community if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C. I have relatively strong priority there (3rd), while other students also value it highly, so I should apply immediately to secure it before it fills. Even if there is competition (Student_C and Student_B are ahead of me in School_C’s priority), an early application is my best chance to land my first choice.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for your application and for naming School_C as your first choice. We appreciate your interest and would be glad to have you join and contribute to our community.

We are pleased to offer you admission to School_C.

[ACTION] [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Student_D is applying to us as their first choice, which is positive. However, on School_C’s true priority list Student_D ranks 3rd (behind Student_C and Student_B). Given the market, Student_C ranks School_C 4th and Student_B ranks School_C 5th, so they are unlikely to apply to us early (or at all), while Student_D and Student_E rank us 1st. With quota 1, accepting Student_D now likely secures a high-priority feasible match; rejecting risks ending unmatched or settling for a lower/uncertain option later.

conversation.message: Dear School_B Admissions, I’m Student_B and School_B is my first-choice school. I’m applying because I strongly value your academic environment and would enthusiastically enroll if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B. Although School_B ranks me 3rd (behind Student_D and Student_A), applying immediately gives me the best chance to secure my first choice before capacity fills. I will clearly express strong commitment and fit to encourage acceptance if they consider multiple applicants this round.

conversation.message: Dear Student_B, thank you for your thoughtful application and for naming School_B as your first choice. After reviewing our priorities for this cycle, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your interest and wish you the best in the process.
conversation.thought: Student_B is #3 on School_B’s true priority list (behind Student_D and Student_A). Although Student_B is applying now and ranks School_B first, accepting immediately would fill our only seat and could prevent matching with higher-priority Student_D or Student_A if they apply in later rounds. Given we are allowed to reject and wait, and higher-priority students have plausible paths to us (Student_D ranks School_B 3rd; Student_A ranks School_B 4th), the optimal strategy to maximize our true priority match is to reject Student_B this round and keep the seat available for higher-priority candidates.

conversation.message: Dear School_A admissions team, I’m Student_A and School_A is my first-choice school. I’m excited about the opportunity to join your community and I’m ready to commit if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is School_A, so I should apply immediately. Although School_A ranks me 3rd (behind Student_B and Student_D), early application is my best chance to secure my first choice before they commit elsewhere.

conversation.message: Dear Student_A, thank you for your strong interest in School_A and for your application. After reviewing our priorities for this cycle, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your consideration and wish you the very best in the rest of the matching process.
conversation.thought: Student_A is 3rd on School_A's true priority list (behind Student_B and Student_D). With quota 1, accepting Student_A now could block a higher-priority match if Student_B or Student_D later apply to School_A (both rank School_A 3rd and 2nd respectively, so they may come later). Since we can only respond once per round and must accept/reject on an APPLY, the optimal move is to reject now to preserve the seat for higher-priority candidates, even at the risk of ending unmatched.

conversation.message: Hello School_D Admissions Committee—I'm Student_C, and School_D is my first-choice school. I’m especially excited about joining a community with strong academic expectations and a supportive culture, and I’m ready to commit fully if admitted. I would be honored to take the available seat and contribute positively to School_D.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_D. I have relatively strong priority there (3rd), and applying immediately maximizes my chance before higher-priority students (especially Student_D and Student_E) potentially take the only seat. I will signal strong commitment and fit to encourage acceptance if possible.

conversation.message: Student_C, thank you for your thoughtful application and for ranking School_D as your first choice. After reviewing applications this round, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your interest in School_D and wish you the very best in your placement process.
conversation.thought: School_D priority order is D > E > C > B > A. In this round, both Student_C and Student_E applied. Student_E is ranked higher than Student_C on our true priority list, and we only have 1 seat. There is no benefit to accepting C now because it would block taking E. Therefore, reject Student_C to preserve capacity for a higher-priority applicant (Student_E).

conversation.message: Hello School_D admissions team. I’m Student_E and I’m very interested in joining School_D. I believe I’d be a strong fit and I’m ready to commit if accepted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C, but School_C’s priority list ranks me 4th (behind Student_C, Student_B, Student_D). With capacity 1, applying immediately is likely to be rejected if higher-priority students apply. School_D ranks me 2nd (behind Student_D) and is still a relatively acceptable option (4th on my true list). To maximize my chance of securing a good match early, I will apply to School_D now, where I have strong priority and a realistic acceptance chance.

conversation.message: Student_E, thank you for your application and your interest in School_D. We’re pleased to offer you admission and would be happy to welcome you to our community. [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: We have quota 1. Our true priority is D > E > C > B > A. In this round we received APPLY from Student_C and Student_E. Student_E is ranked higher than Student_C on our list, and Student_E also ranks us 4th, but they are willing to commit now. Since Student_D (our top choice) has not applied this round and we cannot initiate contact, accepting Student_E secures a higher-priority match than holding out while risking ending up with a lower-ranked student or an empty seat. Therefore accept Student_E.

conversation.message: Dear School_B admissions team, I’m Student_A. School_B is one of my top choices, and I would be excited to join your community. I’m ready to accept an offer immediately if admitted. Thank you for your consideration.
conversation.thought: School_A already rejected me and has me 3rd in its priority, so reapplying is unlikely to succeed. Among remaining schools, School_B is higher on my true preference list than School_E. Also, School_B ranks me 2nd in its priority list, giving me a strong chance if I apply now. I will send a clear commitment-style application to maximize acceptance probability.

conversation.message: Dear Student_A, thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_B. We are pleased to offer you admission—welcome to School_B. [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: School_B has quota 1 and true priority order is D > A > B > C > E. Student_A is my #2, and has now applied. Student_D (my #1) has not contacted me yet and, based on preferences, ranks School_B third (after School_C and School_A), so may never apply if they secure a higher choice. Student_B (my #3) already applied and I rejected, so likely not available. Given the risk of ending unmatched and the high value of Student_A, accepting now maximizes expected outcome while staying near the top of my priority list.

conversation.message:
Dear School_A Admissions Committee,

I’m Student_B and I’m very excited to formally apply to School_A. I’m looking for a rigorous academic environment with supportive teachers and a community that values consistent effort—qualities I strongly associate with School_A. If admitted, I would be enthusiastic to enroll and commit fully to the program.

Thank you very much for your consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_B
conversation.thought: School_B (my top choice) already rejected me and is likely holding out for higher-priority students. Among the remaining unmatched schools, School_A is my 3rd choice and importantly ranks me #1 in its priority list, giving me an excellent chance to secure a high-ranked match immediately. Applying now is optimal to lock in a strong outcome rather than risking ending up with a lower choice later.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for your application and for your thoughtful interest in School_A. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_A. If you are ready to commit, we look forward to welcoming you to our community.

Sincerely,
School_A Admissions
conversation.thought: We have quota 1 and received APPLYs from Student_B and Student_C. On School_A's true priority list, Student_B is ranked #1 (highest), while Student_C is ranked last (#5). Accepting Student_B immediately secures our top choice and avoids the risk of losing them to School_B (their #1) or School_D (their #2) in later rounds. There is no higher-priority candidate than Student_B, so delaying would only add risk with no upside.

conversation.message: Hello School_A Admissions Committee—I'm Student_C. School_A is my top remaining choice, and I’m applying for your open seat. I’m drawn to School_A’s rigorous academics and the opportunity to contribute consistently in class and in the school community. If admitted, I’m ready to commit fully and enroll. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: School_D (my top choice) already rejected me. Among remaining unmatched schools, School_A is my second choice, so I should apply there immediately. However, School_A’s priority list ranks me last, so I need to make a strong commitment/fit case to try to beat competitors who may not apply or may be applying elsewhere. If rejected, I can pivot to School_B next round.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_A. At this time, we have already filled our available seat for this cycle, so we are not able to offer you admission.

We appreciate your consideration and wish you the very best in the rest of the matching process.

Sincerely,
School_A Admissions
conversation.thought: Our quota is 0 and we are already matched with Student_B, who is #1 on School_A’s true priority list. Per rules, with quota 0 we must reject any new [APPLY]. Student_C is also last on our priority list, so even if a seat were open, they would not displace our current match. Therefore we reject Student_C’s application.

conversation.message: Hello School_E Admissions Committee—I'm Student_C, and I’m writing to formally apply for your open seat. While School_E is my lowest remaining option, I would still be genuinely grateful for the opportunity to join your community and I’m ready to commit and enroll immediately if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: Only School_E remains unmatched and it is on my true preference list (ranked 5th). Since my higher-ranked options (D and A) have already rejected me and there are no other available schools, I should apply to School_E to secure a match rather than risk ending unmatched.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

We look forward to welcoming you to our community.

Sincerely,
School_E Admissions Committee
conversation.thought: Student_C is #2 on School_E’s true priority list (behind only Student_A) and is currently applying with a stated willingness to commit immediately. With quota 1 and no higher-priority applicant (Student_A) in this round’s inbox, accepting Student_C secures a very high-priority match and avoids the risk of remaining unmatched if Student_A never applies. Therefore, accept.
